briefdescription.para: Next node in the list.
Previous node in the list.
Head node of the list.
Tail node of the list.
Initialize a list.
Initializer for a list node.
Initializer for a list.
Get a pointer to the item in which a node entry is embedded.
Iterate over all the elements in a list.
Iterate over all the elements in a list With this version of the iterator, it is ok to remove the current element from the list.
Test if a list is empty.
Initialize a list node.
Test if a list node is unlinked.
Concatenate two lists.
Split a list at a node and assign the split portion to a new list.
Move one list to another.
Prepend a node to a list (insert the node at the head of the list)
Append a node to a list (insert the node at the tail of the list)
Get and remove the head of the list. The node argument must be a variable of type GG_LinkedListNode*. It will be set to the head of the list if non empty, or NULL if empty.
Get and remove the tail of the list. The node argument must be a variable of type GG_LinkedListNode*. It will be set to the tail of the list if non empty, or NULL if empty.
Insert a node after another node in a list.
Insert a node before another node in a list.
Remove a node from a list.
Generic linked list of nodes.
General purpose lists.
